content.question: Which of the following best explains a similar motivation behind the establishment of Portuguese trading posts in Africa and the establishment of Portuguese trading posts in Asia?

choices.label: The trading posts in both regions were intended to prevent economic collapse following the disintegration of powerful local empires.
The trading posts in both regions were intended to facilitate commercial cooperation between European states.
The trading posts in both regions were intended to facilitate the transfer of slaves to the Americas.
The trading posts in both regions were intended to allow the Portuguese to control access to heavily trafficked maritime routes.

content.answer: The trading posts in both regions were intended to allow the Portuguese to control access to heavily trafficked maritime routes.
